intro: Struthiola virgata var. pubescens, commonly known as the pubescent struthiola, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, pubescent leaves and stems. The plant produces small, yellowish to orange-colored flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
